methods.description: Gets whether the builtin zoom mechanisms are being used, includes pinch to zoom gestures.
methods.name: GetBuiltInZoomControls

methods.description: Gets whether the database storage API is enabled.
methods.name: GetDatabaseEnabled

methods.description: Gets whether the WebView has access to the device file system.
methods.name: GetDomStorageEnabled

methods.description: Gets whether Javascript is enabled in the current WebView.
methods.name: GetJavaScriptEnabled

methods.description: Gets the text zoom of the page in percent.
methods.name: GetTextZoom

methods.description: Gets the current useragent string being used by the WebView.
methods.name: GetUserAgentString

methods.description: RemoveWebViewer removes a previous WebViewer from the internal store of this extension. Using this method will also stop the "OnPageFinished" event firing for the given WebViewer.
methods.name: RemoveWebViewer

methods.description: Executes the given JavaScript in the current web viewer.
methods.name: RunJavaScript

methods.description: Enables or disables file access within WebView.
methods.name: SetAllowFileAccess

methods.description: Enables the AppCache API and sets the AppCache path to the apps cache directory.
methods.name: SetAppCacheEnabled

methods.description: Sets whether WebView should block resources from network locations (http and https).
methods.name: SetBlockNetworkLoads

methods.description: Sets whether the WebView should use it's builtin zoom mechanisms. This enables or disables zoom gestures such as pinch to zoom.
methods.name: SetBuiltInZoomControls

methods.description: Sets the cachemode the WebView should use, refer to Googles WebSettings documentation for further information on the different cache modes and thier constant values: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/WebSettings.html#LOAD_DEFAULT.
methods.name: SetCacheMode

methods.description: Enables or disables access to the database storage API in the current WebView.
methods.name: SetDatabaseEnabled

methods.description: Sets whether geolocation is enabled in the WebView.
methods.name: SetGeolocationEnabled

methods.description: Can be used to set the initial scale if the webpage doesnt make use of a viewport meta tag, scale is a percentage e.g for 100% enter 100.
methods.name: SetInitialScale

methods.description: Sets whether javascript can open windows automatically via window.open() javascript methods.
methods.name: SetJavaScriptCanOpenWindowsAutomatically

methods.description: Sets whether javascript is enabled in the WebView.
methods.name: SetJavaScriptEnabled

methods.description: Sets whether the WebView loads pages in overview mode, that is, zooms out the content to fit on screen by width.
methods.name: SetLoadWithOverviewMode

methods.description: Sets whether the URL should be checked prior to loading, enabling this will stop the a page from loading if it does not contain the specified URL in the destination URL.
methods.name: SetOverrideURLChange

methods.description: Sets whether WebView should support multiple windows.
methods.name: SetSupportMultipleWindows

methods.description: Sets the text zoom of the page in percent.
methods.name: SetTextZoom

methods.description: Sets whether the current WebView should enable support for the "viewport" HTML meta tag or should use a wide viewport. If set to true and the page contains a Viewport meta tag then the Viewport meta tag is used.
methods.name: SetUseWideViewPort

methods.description: Sets the useragent string for the WebViewer to use.
methods.name: SetUserAgentString

methods.description: SetWebViewer takes a WebViewer and interally stores the object, enabling you to change a variety of settings on the given WebViewer.
methods.name: SetWebViewer

helpString: This extension provides a range of methods for changing the settings for a WebView component. For further documentation and updates check out thunkableblocks.blogspot.com

events.description: Returns the output of the executed JavaScript. This event will only fire on Android KitKat or newer.
events.name: OnJavaScriptOutput

events.description: Fires once the page has finished loading.
events.name: OnPageFinished

name: WebViewTools
